item.title: Beogram 4002: Replacement of Rusty RCA Plugs
item.description:
During my Beogram 4002 (5513) restoration, I swapped out the old, worn-out RCA plugs. The originals were showing their age. I chose robust, gold-plated Amphenol RCA plugs as replacements. These are excellent for transmitting the low-voltage MMC signal to the amplifier. The metal housing provides superior shielding against electromagnetic interference, ensuring signal integrity. Here’s a look after soldering: And here they are secured:..
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/beogram-4002-replacement-of-rusty-rca-plugs/
